conbody.p: The ditatraining project is an open-source effort under Apache license. Each topic should include a comment after the XML prolog that identifies it as part of this project:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!-- This file is part of the DITA Training project hosted on github.com. See the accompanying LICENSE file for applicable licenses.--> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_fqr_fvh_ft">

In the topic prolog, use the <author> element to claim authorship of a topic. Whenever you create a topic or make a significant contribution to an existing topic, remember to update the <prolog> with author information.<prolog> <author type="creator">Sharon Burton</author> <author type="contributor" href="http://www.scriptorium.com" scope="external" format="html">Sarah O'Keefe, Scriptorium</author> <critdates> <created date="2015-04-28"/> <revised date="2015-09-01"/> </critdates> </prolog>

Contributors should be listed in order, so if you make updates, add a second <author> element underneath the first author. If you include a web link, be sure to remember the scope (external) and the format (html) attributes. Use the author attribute to distinguish the primary author (“creator”) and other contributors (“contributor”).

When you create a topic, specify the creation date in the <critdates> elements using the <created> element. When you update a topic, do not change the <created> element. Instead, add a <revised> element with the current date. For both <created> and <revised> elements, use YYYY-MM-DD format.
